text: Pierre Joseph Louis Déjoie (23 February 1896 - 11 July 1969, Port-au-Prince, HaitiHaiti-Référence: Notables et Personalités - Pierre Joseph Louis Déjoie) was a wealthy Haitian sugar planter, industrialist, agricultural engineer, landowner and politician. ==Early years== Déjoie was a descendant of a French slave-holder, and former Haitian President Fabre Geffrard, who overthrew the Faustin empire. He ran for the Presidency against Francois Duvalier in 1957 Haitian general election. His party only won 2 of the 37 seats in the country's Chamber of Deputies, and he received only 26.6% of the vote to Duvalier's 72.4%. ==References== Category:1896 births Category:1969 deaths Category:Candidates for President of Haiti Category:Haitian businesspeople Category:Haitian anti-communists Category:Haitian exiles Category:Haitian people of French descent Category:Haitian people of Mulatto descent Category:20th-century businesspeople
title: Louis Déjoie
